subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 21 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Thaksin confirms Eriksson meeting
Prospective Man City owner Thaksin Shinawatra confirms he has held talks with Sven-Goran Eriksson about City's vacant manager's job.



 
Pearce set for talks on U21s job
Stuart Pearce is set for talks with the FA over the full-time England under-21 coach role.



 
Chelsea in Champions League boost
Chelsea are named among the Champions League's top seeds along with Liverpool, Arsenal and Manchester United.








GOLF




BMW International leaderboard
Ernie Els is among the early leaders at the European Tour's BMW International Open in Munich.



 
Travelers Ch'ship leaderboard
Leading scores from the PGA tournament.



 
PGA Tour close to drugs agreement
The PGA Tour says it expects to have formulated an anti-doping policy by the end of this year.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton - I can hold off Alonso
Lewis Hamilton believes he has a competitive edge over Fernando Alonso that could see him crowned F1 champion.



 
Ferrari 'can regain early form'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo claims there is little to choose between his team and McLaren despite their big lead in the F1 standings.



 
Edwards eager to salvage season
Yamaha rider Colin Edwards says he is keen to kick-start his disappointing season at the British MotoGP at Donington.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton - I can hold off Alonso
Lewis Hamilton believes he has a competitive edge over Fernando Alonso that could see him crowned F1 champion.



 
Ferrari 'can regain early form'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo claims there is little to choose between his team and McLaren despite their big lead in the F1 standings.



 
McLaren duo backed by Coulthard
David Coulthard says McLaren boss Ron Dennis will be able to resolve any differences between Lewis Hamilton and Fernando Alonso.








ATHLETICS




Greene pulls out of European Cup
An ankle injury forces Welshman David Greene to withdraw from the Great Britain team for this weekend's European Cup.



 
Devonish best dashed by mistake
Marlon Devonish could see his 100m personal best removed from the records because of an administrative mistake in Oslo.



 
Idowu shines in Golden League win
Phillips Idowu beats the world's best triple jumpers to claim the opening Golden League meeting in Oslo.








CYCLING




Cavendish backs anti-doping drive
Britain's Mark Cavendish signs the International Cycling Union's new anti-doping charter.



 
T-Mobile sack Ukrainian Honchar
Serhiy Honchar is sacked by his T-Mobile team for violating their code of conduct.



 
Moreau secures Dauphine victory
Frenchman Christophe Moreau wins the Dauphine Libere after a rain-hit final stage is won by Alexandre Vinokourov.








FUN AND GAMES




Dutch courage
Robbo has the answer to why England never win penalty shoot-outs



 
Ten to Tackle
How much can you remember about the past week's sport?



 
Angel delight
Robbo on why it cheers him to see out-of-shape sportsmen winning trophies
